item.title: What’s Switzerland’s ‘Anti-Burqa’ Law That Comes Into Effect From January 1? | Explained - News18
item.description:
What’s Switzerland’s ‘Anti-Burqa’ Law That Comes Into Effect From January 1? | Explained

Date: January 02, 2025

Source: News18

From January 1, 2025, Switzerland officially bans burqas, hijabs, and any other face coverings in public spaces, as mandated by a law solidified in 2023 after a 2021 referendum where 51.2% of voters supported the ban.

  • The law includes fines of up to 1,000 francs for violators.
  • Exceptions are made for health-related facial coverings and coverings in places of worship.
  • The proposal was driven by the right-wing Swiss People's Party, citing concerns over extremism.
  • The Muslim population in Switzerland is predominantly from Turkey, Bosnia, and Kosovo, making up about 5% of the total population.
“Today’s decision opens old wounds, further expands the principle of legal inequality, and sends a clear signal of exclusion to the Muslim minority.” - Central Council of Muslims

This law raises significant discussions on women's rights, identity, and the ongoing debate surrounding secularism and multiculturalism in Switzerland.

item.title: Gautam Gambhir Under Scanner: Report Says "Players Insecure". After Champions Trophy, Coach May Be... - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Gautam Gambhir Under Scanner: Report Says 'Players Insecure'

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 Source: NDTV

Gautam Gambhir, the Indian cricket team coach, is under scrutiny following a series of poor performances by the team. After his appointment, India has struggled significantly, raising concerns about player communication and team stability.

  • Gambhir took over as head coach expecting to lead a transition in the team.
  • The team suffered losses against Sri Lanka and New Zealand, and is trailing in the ongoing Test series against Australia.
  • Reports indicate that players feel insecure due to constant lineup experimentation by Gambhir.
  • There are concerns about communication issues between Gambhir and the players, especially compared to previous coaches like Ravi Shastri.
  • With the upcoming Champions Trophy, Gambhir's position may be in jeopardy if performances do not improve.
"If the performance doesn't improve, even Gautam Gambhir's position wouldn't be safe," a senior BCCI official stated.

This situation raises questions about the future of the Indian cricket team under Gambhir as tension mounts ahead of critical tournaments.

item.title: OnePlus 13 series India launch on 7 January: Price, Specifications, and live streaming details - India TV News
item.description:
OnePlus 13 Series India Launch on 7 January: Price, Specifications, and Live Streaming Details

Publication Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: India TV

OnePlus is poised to unveil its flagship smartphones, the OnePlus 13 and OnePlus 13R, on January 7, 2025, as part of its Winter Event in India. The event will also introduce the OnePlus Buds Pro 3. Following a successful launch in China, there is significant excitement among Indian consumers.

Key Points:

  • The expected price for the OnePlus 13 ranges between Rs 67,000 and Rs 70,000, reflecting a slight increase from its predecessor.
  • It features a 6.82-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate.
  • The OnePlus 13 is powered by the Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, enhancing multitasking and gaming performance.
  • The camera system includes three 50MP sensors co-engineered with Hasselblad.
  • The smartphone is backed by a 6,000mAh battery with 100W fast charging capabilities.

How to Watch the OnePlus Winter Event Live:

The event will be streamed live on the OnePlus official website and YouTube channel on January 7.

Notable Quotes:

“With its latest flagship, OnePlus aims to strengthen its position in the premium smartphone segment.”

Overall, the upcoming launch of the OnePlus 13 series is anticipated to generate significant interest and engagement among tech enthusiasts in India.

item.title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue subscribed over 130 times so far; check GMP. Apply or not? | Stock Market News - Mint
item.description:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Day 3 Live Updates: Issue Subscribed Over 130 Times

Date: 02 Jan 2025 | Source: HT Digital Streams

The Indo Farm Equipment IPO, aimed at raising ₹260.15 crore, has seen significant demand as it enters its final day of subscription, having already been oversubscribed more than 130 times.

  • IPO price band set at ₹204 to ₹215 per share.
  • Key subscription numbers: QIB segment booked 57.96 times, NII portion 349.31 times, retail quota 78.56 times.
  • Expected listing gains indicated by a grey market premium (GMP) of ₹90.
“Given industry tailwinds and superior financial metrics, we assign a SUBSCRIBE rating to the IPO.”

This IPO offers promising growth potential backed by a robust demand in both domestic and international markets for agricultural equipment.

item.title: First meteor shower of 2025 is coming. How to catch the Quadrantids - India Today
item.description:
First Meteor Shower of 2025: How to Catch the Quadrantids

Published On: Jan 2, 2025 | Source: India Today

As the new year unfolds, stargazers are in for a treat with the Quadrantid meteor shower, which peaks on January 3-4, 2025. This celestial event marks the first significant meteor shower of the year, offering a dazzling display of fireballs streaking across the night sky.

  • The Quadrantids are a unique meteor shower, originating from the asteroid 2003 EH1.
  • They peak at 60 to 120 meteors per hour under ideal conditions.
  • The meteor shower is visible particularly between 3:00 AM and 5:00 AM local time.
  • Quadrantids typically do not leave long trails but can be bright fireballs.
  • The meteor shower will remain active until January 16, 2025.
Nasa's William Cooke notes that while Quadrantids typically do not leave long trails, their heads can appear as bright fireballs.

Finding a dark location away from city lights is essential for optimal viewing. Minimal moonlight interference offers an excellent opportunity for celestial enthusiasts to enjoy this spectacular event.

item.title: Israeli airstrike kills at least 10 in southern Gaza, medics say - Reuters
item.description:
Israeli Airstrike Kills 10 in Southern Gaza, Medics Report

Date: January 2, 2025 | Source: Reuters

The early morning airstrike killed at least 10 Palestinians, including women and children, in a tent encampment intended for displaced families in southern Gaza.

  • The incident occurred in Al-Mawasi, a designated humanitarian area in Khan Younis.
  • Fifteen additional individuals suffered injuries in the strike.
  • Notable figures, including two police department officials, were among the casualties.
  • Israel's military has not provided an immediate comment regarding the attack.
  • Since the outbreak of war, over 45,500 Palestinians have been reported killed according to health officials in Gaza.
“Most of Gaza's 2.3 million people have been displaced, and much of the tiny coastal strip is in ruins.”

This latest airstrike underscores the ongoing humanitarian crisis and violence in the Gaza Strip, where civilian casualties continue to rise significantly amid the conflict.

item.title: Bajaj Finance shares jump over 5% as Citi maintains 'Buy' on Q3 optimism, sees up to 17% upside for stock - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Bajaj Finance shares jump over 5% as Citi maintains 'Buy' on Q3 optimism, sees up to 17% upside for stock

Date: January 02, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

Bajaj Finance share price surged over 5 percent in Thursday's trade after analysts at the brokerage Citi reiterated its 'Buy' rating on the stock. The stock climbed to an intraday high of Rs 7,306.05, marking a 5.34 percent gain from its previous close.

  • Citi has set a price target of Rs 8,150 for Bajaj Finance, indicating a potential upside of 17.51 percent from Wednesday's closing price.
  • The brokerage highlighted expectations of loan growth stability and a positive bias in net interest margins.
  • Key support is coming from segments like mortgage financing and sales financing.
  • A marginal rise in credit costs is estimated between 2.2 to 2.5 percent.
"Key support is coming from segments like mortgage financing, sales financing, and new business ventures," Citi noted in its report.

This positive movement in Bajaj Finance shares aligns with the overall rise in the finance and NBFC sector.

item.title: India's dressing room confidentiality breach an unexpected storm, 'leak' reeks of Chappell-Ganguly, Kohli-Kumble feuds - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India's Dressing Room Confidentiality Breach: A Storm of Controversy

Date: Jan 02, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

In an unexpected turn of events, leaks from within the Indian cricket team following a disappointing defeat against Australia have raised concerns about the sanctity of the dressing room. This breach of confidentiality has drawn parallels to past controversies involving high-profile figures in Indian cricket.

  • The dressing room is traditionally a private space for players to express themselves freely.
  • Recent alleged leaks come just before a crucial Test match, highlighting the timing's unfortunate nature.
  • Historical precedents show detrimental effects of such leaks on team dynamics and morale.
  • The head coach has publicly addressed the situation, emphasizing the need for honesty and integrity among players.
  • Drawing from past resilience, the team aims to overcome adversity and focus on performance.
“Those are just reports. That's not the truth... Honesty is extremely important if you want to go on and achieve some great things.” - Head Coach Gautam Gambhir

This situation underscores the challenges faced by the team but also serves as a reminder of their capacity to rally together and perform against the odds.

item.title: Farmers Protest | 'Your Attitude Is There Should Be No Reconciliation' : Supreme Court Pulls Up Punjab Govt For Not Shifting Dallewal To Hospital - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Urges Punjab Government to Ensure Medical Aid for Hunger-Striking Farmers Leader

Date: January 2, 2024 | Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court expressed displeasure at the Punjab Government for failing to ensure that farmers' leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who is on a hunger strike, is moved to a hospital, emphasizing that he can continue his fast with medical support.

  • The Court clarified that Dallewal can maintain his hunger strike while receiving necessary medical care.
  • Justice Kant criticized the media and state officials for misrepresenting the Court's intentions regarding Dallewal's fast.
  • Dallewal's stance is that he will only accept medical aid if the Centre agrees to negotiate.
  • The Punjab Government has been directed to take steps for Dallewal's health without forcing him to break his fast.
  • The Court highlighted the necessity of reconciliation and health care for Dallewal as a leadership figure for farmers.
“His life is precious as a farm leader. He is not aligned to any political ideologies and he is taking care of only the farmers' cause.” - Justice Surya Kant

The court's actions underscore the ongoing tension between the farmers' protests and governmental responses, with the matter to be revisited on Monday.

item.title: Gambhir non-committal on Rohit Sharma's selection for SCG Test - Cricbuzz
item.description:
Gambhir Non-Committal on Rohit Sharma's Selection for SCG Test

Published on: Thu, Jan 2, 2025, 06:52 AM
Source: Cricbuzz

Amidst speculation, India's head coach Gautam Gambhir did not confirm Rohit Sharma's inclusion in the final Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy series in Sydney. Rohit has struggled significantly in the longest format since October 2023, raising questions regarding his current form.

  • Gautam Gambhir suggests that everything is fine with Rohit despite his absence from media duties.
  • Rohit has averaged just 11.69 over his last seven Tests, with only 31 runs across six innings on the current tour.
  • Gambhir emphasized the team's need for a balance between aggression and restraint in batting.
  • Confidence remains high in the dressing room to retain the Border-Gavaskar Trophy despite recent losses.
“Extremely, extremely confident [of winning]. You know, we've got the skill set. We've got the individuals.” - Gautam Gambhir

With ongoing debates about team composition and performance expectations, Gambhir remains committed to focusing on team needs rather than individual performances.

item.title: Fans call Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Diljit Dosanjh’s ‘memorable meeting’ the ‘first unexpected col - TOI Etimes
item.description:
Fans call PM Modi and Diljit Dosanjh’s meeting the ‘first unexpected collaboration of 2025’

Publication Date: January 1, 2025
Source: Times of India

The New Year dawned with an unexpected yet memorable meeting between Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and global icon Diljit Dosanjh, sparking excitement on social media.

  • Diljit Dosanjh celebrated the start of 2025 with a meeting with PM Modi.
  • The meeting was shared on social media, highlighting their warm interaction.
  • PM Modi praised Diljit, emphasizing the pride of seeing talent from small beginnings shine globally.
  • Diljit expressed his realization of India's greatness through his travels.
  • The joint post received an enthusiastic response, with fans dubbing it the 'first unexpected collaboration of 2025.'
“When a boy from a small village in 'Hindustan' shines on the global stage, it feels amazing.” - PM Modi
“A fantastic start to 2025. A very memorable meeting with PM @narendramodi Ji.” - Diljit Dosanjh

This heartwarming interaction highlights the blend of music, culture, and the importance of recognizing the human connections behind public figures.

item.title: Anna University sexual assault case being politicised without genuine concern, says Madras HC Judge - The Hindu
item.description:
Madras HC Judge Critiques Political Response to Anna University Sexual Assault Case

Publication Date: January 02, 2025 11:41 am IST

Source: The Hindu

Justice P. Velmurugan of the Madras High Court expressed deep concern over the politicization of the Anna University sexual assault case, highlighting societal indifference towards women's rights and criticizing the lack of genuine concerns from political parties.

  • The Judge emphasized that the incident should serve as a wake-up call to society.
  • Political protests were seen as attempts to gain media attention rather than authentic concern.
  • Justice Velmurugan criticized the media for conducting a 'media trial' rather than responsible reporting.
  • He condemned the mindset of viewing women as needing 'protection,' advocating for gender equality.
  • An all-woman IPS officers’ team has been formed to investigate the case.
“I’m ashamed to live in this era when discrimination based on gender, caste, and so on continues.” - Justice P. Velmurugan

In conclusion, the Judge called for collective shame in the face of ongoing gender discrimination and underscored the need for real change in societal attitudes towards women.

item.title: Setback for Hindu monk Chinmoy Krishna Das as Bangladesh court rejects bail plea - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bangladesh Court Denies Bail to Hindu Monk Chinmoy Krishna Das

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A Chattogram court in Bangladesh has denied bail to Chinmoy Krishna Das, a former ISKCON monk, during a tightly secured hearing.

  • The court hearing lasted about 30 minutes with arguments presented by both sides.
  • A team of 11 Supreme Court lawyers represented Chinmoy Krishna Das.
  • His bail plea was rejected by Metropolitan Sessions judge Md Saiful Islam.
  • Chinmoy faces sedition charges for allegedly raising a saffron flag above Bangladesh's national flag.
  • His arrest on November 25 led to protests and clashes resulting in a lawyer's death.
  • Additional arrests of fellow monks occurred amid the unrest.
  • The Indian government expressed concern over the situation in Bangladesh.
“We will move for Chinmoy in the court for his bail.” - Lawyer Apurba Kumar Bhattacharjee

The decision by the Chattogram court highlights ongoing tensions in Bangladesh regarding minority rights and protests against extremism.

item.title: ​8 Beautiful Unseen Deep Space Pictures Captured By NASA​ - Times Now
item.description:
8 Beautiful Unseen Deep Space Pictures Captured By NASA

Date: Jan 2, 2025 | Source: Times Now

This article showcases eight stunning images captured by NASA, revealing the breathtaking beauty and complexity of deep space. Each image highlights various celestial phenomena as observed by the Hubble Space Telescope.

  • Arp-Madore 2339-661: Interacting galaxies that highlight complex gravitational interactions.
  • XZ Tauri: A multiple star system expelling hot gas bubbles, showcasing star formation.
  • From Dim To Dazzling: A vibrant star-forming region within the Milky Way.
  • A Spiral Star Factory: The spiral galaxy NGC 5668 known for its star formation.
  • Stellar Ensemble In NGC 6357: A star cluster that ionizes parts of the emission nebula.
  • Stellar Remnant SNR 0509-68.7: A supernova remnant closely studied by astronomers.
  • NGC 6302: A planetary nebula, known as the butterfly nebula, formed by a fading star.
  • AFGL 5180: A star-forming region providing insights into solar system formation.
"These images not only mesmerize but also promote an understanding of the universe we inhabit." - TN Tech Desk

In conclusion, these breathtaking images taken by NASA serve as a reminder of the vast beauty and complexity of the universe, inspiring curiosity and further exploration.

item.title: New York: At least 11 shot at in night club in Queens - CNBCTV18
item.description:
At Least 11 Shot in Queens Night Club Shooting

Date: January 2, 2025

Source: CNBC TV18

Reports indicate that gunfire erupted at the Amazura event hall in Jamaica, Queens, resulting in at least 11 injuries.

  • The shooting occurred around 11:20 PM on January 1.
  • Details on the conditions of the injured individuals have not been released by the NYPD yet.
  • The incident is part of a growing concern over gun violence in the United States.
“At least 11 people have been shot in Queens, NY at Amazura Night Club. This is still an ACTIVE situation.” — Nick Sortor

This shooting adds to the troubling pattern of violent incidents affecting public safety in the US.

item.title: New York mass shooting: At least 11 shot as gunman fires inside Amazura Night Club in Queens, say reports | Today News - Mint
item.description:
At least 11 shot outside Amazura Night Club in Queens

Publication Date: January 2, 2025

Source: New York Post

The incident occurred just before 11:20 pm near the Amazura nightclub in Jamaica, New York. At least 11 individuals were shot but are expected to survive, according to the NYPD.

  • The shooting took place outside the Amazura nightclub.
  • Victims were transported to nearby hospitals, including Long Island Jewish Hospital.
  • None of the victims are in critical condition.
  • Footage of the scene shows a significant police and ambulance presence.
“All are expected to survive.” — NYPD

This incident comes on the heels of a deadly attack in New Orleans that left 15 dead.

The Amazura nightclub is known for its vibrant atmosphere, featuring dancing, DJs, and live performances.

item.title: Manufacturing PMI slips to a 12-month low of 56.4 in Dec - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Manufacturing PMI slips to a 12-month low of 56.4 in December

Publication Date: January 02, 2025

Source: Moneycontrol

India’s manufacturing activity closed the year at a 12-month low of 56.4 in December compared with 56.5 a month back, according to a private sector survey released on January 2.

  • The HSBC India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index declined from 57.5 to 56.5 in November.
  • This marks the second consecutive month of decline in manufacturing activity.
  • The index averaged over 57.5 in 2024, compared with 56.8 in the previous year.
“December marks the second consecutive month of decline in activity.”

This decline in the manufacturing PMI suggests potential challenges in the industrial sector moving forward.

item.title: Magnus Carlsen defends Blitz title, shares it with Nepomniachtchi; Wenjun Champion in Women’s section - Sportstar
item.description:
Magnus Carlsen defends Blitz title, beats Nepomniachtchi in final; Wenjun Champion in Women’s section

Date: January 1, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

In a historic conclusion to the World Blitz Championship 2024 on Wall Street, New York, reigning champion Magnus Carlsen shared the title with Ian Nepomniachtchi after a series of draws in sudden-death play. Despite Carlsen's initial wins, Nepomniachtchi's resilience forced a tie, leading to an unprecedented decision of shared victory.

  • Carlsen and Nepomniachtchi ended the game tied at 2-2, resulting in three drawn games in sudden-death.
  • This match mirrored the 2021 Classical World Championship, enhancing its historical significance.
  • Carlsen has now won eight Blitz titles and 18 major championships overall.
  • Ju Wenjun claimed the Women's World Blitz Championship by defeating Lei Tingjie.
  • India’s R. Vaishali advanced in the tournament but was defeated by Wenjun in the semifinals.
— International Chess Federation (@FIDE_chess) January 1, 2025

This championship showcases the high-level competition in chess and the continuing evolution of the game.

item.title: ‘AAP Govt should rise above party politics, take decisions in farmers’ interest’: Shivraj writes to Atishi - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Stop playing politics with farmers’ welfare’: Shivraj Chouhan to Delhi CM Atishi

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has criticized the AAP government for failing to implement central schemes benefiting farmers and emphasized the need for political unity in addressing farmers' issues.

  • Chouhan expressed concerns about the indifference of the AAP government towards farmers.
  • He criticized former chief minister Arvind Kejriwal for prioritizing political gain over farmers' welfare.
  • Chouhan highlighted the non-implementation of important agricultural schemes in Delhi.
  • His letter comes ahead of the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections.
“Political competition should not become an obstacle to farmers’ welfare. Farmers’ welfare is the duty of all governments.” - Shivraj Singh Chouhan

Chouhan's appeal emphasizes the importance of prioritizing the needs of farmers above political interests as elections approach.

item.title: Step inside Vinod Kambli's luxurious home worth Rs..., defaulted on home loan, it can be taken away due to non-payment of Rs... - India.com
item.description:
Inside Vinod Kambli's Luxurious Home and Recent Financial Struggles

Published: Date not provided Source: India.com

The article provides an overview of former Indian cricketer Vinod Kambli's luxurious home in Mumbai, valued at over Rs 8 crore, and discusses his current financial difficulties with loan defaults.

  • Vinod Kambli's home is located in Mumbai and is valued at over Rs 8 crore.
  • He has defaulted on home and car loans from DNS Bank since 2014.
  • Kambli and his wife Andrea Hewitt have been declared defaulters publicly.
  • They owe maintenance fees of over Rs 18 lakh to their co-operative society.
  • Kambli has received financial assistance of Rs 5 lakh from the Shiv Sena party.
“The couple have been marked as defaulters by the co-operative society of the apartment and their flat can even be taken away if the dues are not cleared.”

The financial situation of Kambli highlights the struggles faced by some retired athletes despite their previous successes.

item.title: Eclipse, Meteors, Auroras, Supermoon in 2025 - Deccan Chronicle
item.description:
Celestial Events to Look Forward to in 2025: Eclipses, Supermoons, and More

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: AP News

The year 2025 will feature a series of spectacular astronomical events including eclipses, supermoons, and a parade of planets. Stargazers can expect multiple opportunities to witness these cosmic occurrences, enhancing the viewing experience for enthusiasts.

  • January will kick off with a six-planet parade visible for an extended period.
  • The first lunar eclipse will occur on March 14, followed by a partial solar eclipse two weeks later.
  • Three supermoons are expected in October, November, and December, with the closest occurring in November.
  • A line-up of six planets will be visible around mid-January.
  • Geomagnetic storms may lead to enhanced displays of the northern and southern lights throughout the year.
  • Popular meteor showers such as the Perseids and Geminids will peak in August and December.
“People should go out and see them sometime during the next many weeks. I certainly will,” said Bruce Betts, chief scientist at the Planetary Society.

In conclusion, astronomy enthusiasts have much to look forward to in 2025, with various celestial events expected to delight and inspire star watchers around the globe.
